newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner sees room for share to rise.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner sees room for share to rise.

text.p: Germany's Dresdner Bank AG on Friday repeated that its current share price did not reflect the value of the bank and had room to rise.

Chief executive Juergen Sarrazin told the bank's annual general meeting he welcomed the recent gains in Dresdner's share price, which he said reflected a positive market reaction to the bank's strategy.
"There is more room for gains here," Sarrazin said in the text of a speech.
"The hidden reserves in our non-bank investments alone are, at 15 billion marks, more than half our market capitalisation," Sarrazin said.
Dresdner's shares were trading 80 pfennigs higher at 62.60 marks on Friday.
